sgw_utils.io.formatting module¶

sgw_utils.io.formatting.convert_to_onehot(labels)[source]¶

Convert label array to one-hot vector by Keras function ‘to_categorical’.

Parameters:labels – Numpy integer array representing label indices.
Returns:One-hot labels.
sgw_utils.io.formatting.make_set_xy(loaded_npy, label_type='sklearn')[source]¶

Arange numpy features to the format used for inputting to classifiers.

Parameters:
  • loaded_npy – Numpy features in shape of (classes_num, samples_num, dimensionality).
  • label_type –

    Label type of platform where you will use returned set:

    • sklearn: For scikit-learn platform like [0, 0, ..., 1, 1].
    • keras: For Keras platform (one-hot representation) like [[1,0], [1,0], ..., [0,1], [0,1]].
Returns:

Tuple of (<vertically stacked features>, <corresponding labels>).
sgw_utils.io.formatting.split_into_batches(data, batch_size=100)[source]¶

Split input data into some batches.

Parameters:
  • data – Target data in numpy array.
  • batch_size – Size of batches. This works based on numpy function ‘array_split’.
Returns:

List of Batches.

sgw_utils.io.generator module¶

class sgw_utils.io.generator.DataIterator(featurewise_center=False, samplewise_center=False, featurewise_std_normalization=False, samplewise_std_normalization=False, zca_whitening=False, rotation_range=0.0, width_shift_range=0.0, height_shift_range=0.0, shear_range=0.0, zoom_range=0.0, channel_shift_range=0.0, fill_mode='nearest', cval=0.0, horizontal_flip=False, vertical_flip=False, rescale=None, preprocessing_function=None, data_format=None)[source]¶

Bases: keras.preprocessing.image.ImageDataGenerator

Overloaded class on ImageDataGenerator for avoiding from any data augmentations.

random_transform(x)[source]¶
class sgw_utils.io.generator.ImageNetDataGenerator(featurewise_center=False, samplewise_center=False, featurewise_std_normalization=False, samplewise_std_normalization=False, zca_whitening=False, rotation_range=0.0, width_shift_range=0.0, height_shift_range=0.0, shear_range=0.0, zoom_range=0.0, channel_shift_range=0.0, fill_mode='nearest', cval=0.0, horizontal_flip=False, vertical_flip=False, rescale=None, preprocessing_function=None, data_format=None)[source]¶

Bases: keras.preprocessing.image.ImageDataGenerator

Overloaded class on Keras ‘ImageDataGenerator’, which is aiming at including preprocess for ‘inception’ and ‘vgg’.

self.rescale works as a kerword of preprocessing type like:

  • In case self.rescale = ‘inception’, preprocess on image in the same manner as GoogLeNet.
  • In case self.rescale = ‘vgg’, preprocess on image in the same manner as VGG16.
standardize(x)[source]¶
class sgw_utils.io.generator.NumpyArrayIterator_LargeChannelAdapted(x, y, image_data_generator, batch_size=32, shuffle=False, seed=None, dim_ordering='default', save_to_dir=None, save_prefix='', save_format='jpeg')[source]¶

Bases: keras.preprocessing.image.NumpyArrayIterator

Overloaded class on NumpyArrayIterator in order to let further data input even not formatted as images. by making a comment-out for exceptions on the input dimensionality.

sgw_utils.io.generator.generator_preparation(images, labels, batch_size=100, preprocessing_type='inception', shuffle=False, save_image_prefix=None)[source]¶

Create generator from images in a single directory.

Parameters:
  • images – Images to be stacked on a quene of a generator.
  • labels –

    Corresponidng labels.

    • If you use on Keras platform, you have to convert the label to one-hot format in advance.
  • batch_size – Batch size when feeding from generator.
  • type – Preprocessing type of images. See the documentation of ‘image’ module for the details.
  • shuffle – Flag to shuffle set of image and label before constructing a generator.
  • save_image_prefix – See ‘Image Preprocessing’ documentation in Keras because of Keras-based implementation.
Retrun:

Generator object based on Keras.
sgw_utils.io.generator.generator_preparation_from_dirs(dirpath, target_size, classes=None, batch_size=100, shuffle=False, preprocessing_type='inception', save_image_prefix=None, class_separation=False, validation_include=True)[source]¶

Crate generators from at least one directories including images.

Parameters:
  • dirpath – Base directory containing sub-directories.
  • target_size – Shape for resizing images. None works as keep the original shape.
  • class – List of the sub-directories’ naems arranged in order of class labels. None works as to load images from ‘dirpath’ directory (ingore any sub-directories).
  • batch_size – Batch size when feeding from generator.
  • preprocessing_type – Preprocessing type of images. See the documentation of ‘image’ module for the details.
  • shuffle – Flag to shuffle set of image and label before constructing a generator.
  • save_image_prefix – See ‘Image Preprocessing’ documentation in Keras because of Keras-based implementation.
  • class_separation – Flag to separate generators into classes. This flag is usually used in except training phase. Consequently, returned objects are arranged as list of generators for each class.
  • validation_include – Flag to load images from subdirectories under each of ‘train’ and ‘validation’ directories. This flag is usually used only in training phase.
Retrun:

Generato object based on Keras.

sgw_utils.io.image module¶

sgw_utils.io.image.crop_imgs(img, patch_size=32)[source]¶

Crop patches from the source image along the scan lines.

Parameters:
  • img – Source image.
  • patch_size – The edge length of cropped patches.
Returns:

List of cropped patches.
sgw_utils.io.image.feature_select_switcher(feature_keyword, image_dir=None, output_dir='./', identifier=None, extension='jpg', max_threads=1, load_GMM_dir=None)[source]¶

Helper to easily determine which feature to be returned.

Parameters:
  • feature_keyword –

    Keyword for feature data which will be returned finally:

    • If a path to a file of features is given, this will return loaded numpy array.
    • If a type of feature and image_dir are given, this will return calculated features with the type.
      • Now ‘gabor’ and ‘fisher’ are available as feature types.
    • If an unrecognized string or None is given, this will return None.
  • image_dir – Directory including images for calculating features. This will be ignored when feature file is already existing.
  • output_dir – Output directory for calculated feature file. This will be also ignored when feature file is already existing.
  • identifier – Identifier of file name of features. This will be used as like “<identifier>_<feature_keyword>_features.npy”
  • extension – Suffix of images to be loaded.
  • max_threads – Max threads for multiprocessing. Default of ‘1’ means the multiprocessing will be disable.
  • load_GMM_dir – (ignored except fisher feature)Directory of GMM paramterers which were calcluated at training time in advance. In general this flag should work when evaluation.
Returns:

Calculated or loaded features as numpy array.
sgw_utils.io.image.get_crop_locs(shape, patch_size=32)[source]¶

Get locations where patches are cropped in a source image.

Parameters:
  • shape – Shape of source image you suppose.
  • patch_size – The edge length of cropped patches.
Returns:

Cropping location as list of ((tl_y tl_x), (br_y, br_x)).
sgw_utils.io.image.get_crop_masks(shape, patch_size=32)[source]¶

Get masks for cropping regions in a source image.

Parameters:
  • shape – Shape of source image you suppose.
  • patch_size – The edge length of cropped patches.
Returns:

List of the masks of numpy array.
sgw_utils.io.image.load_images_from_dirs(basedir, classnames, image_shape=(299, 299), extension='*', max_smps=-1, max_threads=1, vervosity=1)[source]¶

Load images from sub-directories and pre-resize them.

Parameters:
  • basedir – Base directory containing sub-directories including images to be loaded.
  • classnames – List of the sub-directories’ naems arranged in order of class labels.
  • image_shape – Shape of loaded images for resizing.
  • extension – Suffix of images to be loaded.
  • max_smps – Limitation of images to be loaded. Default of ‘-1’ means the entire images will be loaded.
  • max_threads – Max threads for multiprocessing. Default of ‘1’ means the multiprocessing will be disable.
  • vervosity (bool) – Vervosity on displaying status.
Returns:

Loaded and resized images as list of numpy array in shape of (samples_num, image_shape[0], image_shape[1]).
sgw_utils.io.image.load_images_in_dir(dirname, image_shape=(299, 299), extension='*', max_smps=-1, max_threads=1, vervosity=1)[source]¶

Load images from a single directory and pre-resize them.

Parameters:
  • dirname – Directory including images to be loaded.
  • image_shape – Shape of loaded images for resizing.
  • extension – Suffix of images to be loaded.
  • max_smps – Limitation of images to be loaded. Default of ‘-1’ means the entire images will be loaded.
  • max_threads – Max threads for multiprocessing. Default of ‘1’ means the multiprocessing will be disable.
  • vervosity (bool) – Vervosity on displaying status.
Returns:

Loaded and resized images as numpy array in shape of (classes_num, samples_num, image_shape[0], image_shape[1]).
sgw_utils.io.image.mp_func(args)[source]¶
sgw_utils.io.image.preprocess_on_images(images, type='inception', vervosity=1)[source]¶

Preprocess on the images by several types of method.

Parameters:
  • images – Target images. Numpy array of multiple images like (sample_num, height, width) is also allowed to be this input.
  • type –

    Preprocessing type. You can choose from ‘inception’, ‘vgg’, and ‘disable’:

    • inception: Apply GoogLeNet based method that makes values supressed within (-1.0, 1.0).
    • vgg: Apply VGG based method that subtracts specific values from image values in RBG respectively. This has been implemented on Keras.
    • disable: Not apply any methods of preprocessing.
  • vervosity (bool) – Vervosity on displaying status.
Returns:

Loaded and resized images as numpy array in shape of (samples_num, image_shape[0], image_shape[1]).
